text: Mr. Patrick Goggins
label: BODY

label: HH3

label: BODY

text: Re:
label: BODY

text: Findings of Violation and Administrative
label: BODY

text: Order for Compliance
label: BODY

text: Docket No. CWA-08-2004-0048
label: BODY

text: Dear Mr. Goggins:
label: BODY

text: Based on our review of all available information, the United States Environmental
label: BODY

text: Protection Agency (“EPA”) has determined that you are in violation of the Clean Water Act, as
label: BODY

text: amended (“CWA”).  The CWA requires that an authorizing permit be obtained from the United
label: BODY

text: States Army Corps of Engineers prior to the discharge of dredged or fill material into waters of
label: BODY

text: the United States.  See, 33 U.S.C. § 1311.  Waters of the United States include both surface
label: BODY

text: waters and wetlands as defined by 33 C.F.R. § 328.3.
label: BODY

text: Specifically, you have discharged fill material into waters of the United States without
label: BODY

text: authorization under the CWA.  These discharges of pollutants into the Yellowstone River, both
label: BODY

text: above and below the ordinary high water mark, have occurred on your property at a site located
label: BODY

text: in section 6, Township 2 North, Range 28 East, Yellowstone County, Montana.
label: BODY

text: Enclosed is a document entitled “Findings of Violation and Administrative Order for
label: BODY

text: Compliance” (“Order”) which specifies the nature of the violations and describes actions
label: BODY

text: necessary in order for you to achieve compliance with the CWA.  EPA’s authority for such action
label: BODY

text: is provided under section 309(a)(3) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1319(a)(3).  Pursuant to the Order,
label: BODY

text: within five days after you receive the Order you must inform EPA in writing of your intent to
label: BODY

text: fully comply with the Order.
label: BODY

text: The CWA requires the Administrator of EPA to take all appropriate enforcement action
label: BODY

text: necessary to secure prompt compliance with the CWA and any order issued thereunder.  Section
label: BODY

text: 309 of the CWA authorizes a variety of possible enforcement actions, including filing of a civil
label: BODY

text: or criminal action, administrative penalty action, and/or debarment from Federal contracts and/or
label: BODY

text: UNITED  STATES  ENVIRONMENTAL  PROTECTION  AGENCY
label: HH1

text: REGION  8
label: BODY

text: 999 18TH STREET  -  SUITE 300
label: BODY

text: DENVER,  CO   80202-2466
label: BODY

text: http://www.epa.gov/region08
label: BODY

text: Printed on Recycled Paper
label: BODY

text: loans for any noncompliance with the CWA or an order issued pursuant to the CWA.  Please be
label: BODY

text: advised that failure to comply with the requirements of the Order is a violation of the Order and
label: BODY

text: may be enforced through the mechanisms referenced above.  Please also be advised that the
label: BODY

text: issuance of this Order does not preclude civil or criminal actions in the U.S. District Court
label: BODY

text: pursuant to sections 309(b) or (c) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. §§ 1319(b) or (c), or assessment of
label: BODY

text: civil penalties pursuant to sections 309(d) or (g) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. §§ 1319(d) or (g), for
label: BODY

text: the violations cited in the Order or for any other violations that Patrick Goggins and/or the
label: BODY

text: Vermilion Ranch Co. may have committed prior to or may commit after the issuance of the
label: BODY

text: enclosed Order.
label: BODY

text: EPA has agreed to notify small businesses of their right to comment on regulatory
label: BODY

text: enforcement activities at the time of an Agency enforcement activity pursuant to the Small
label: BODY

text: Business Regulatory Enforcement and Fairness Act (“SBREFA”).  SBREFA does not eliminate
label: BODY

text: your responsibility to comply with the Act or this order, nor does it create any new rights or
label: BODY

text: defenses under law.  We have enclosed a SBREFA information sheet containing further
label: BODY

text: information on compliance assistance resources and tools available to small businesses.
label: BODY

text: Please review the Order carefully.  If you have any questions, the most knowledgeable
label: BODY

text: people on my staff are Sheldon Muller, Enforcement Attorney, at 303-312-6916, and Kris
label: BODY

text: Knutson, Enforcement Officer, at 406-457-5021.
label: BODY

text: Sincerely,
label: BODY

label: HH2

label: HH2

text: FINDINGS OF VIOLATION AND
label: HH1

text: ADMINISTRATIVE ORDER FOR
label: HH1

text: COMPLIANCE
label: H1

text: Docket No. CWA-08-2004-0048
label: BODY

text: I.  STATUTORY AUTHORITY
label: HH3

text: 1. This Findings of Violation and Administrative Order for Compliance (“Order”) is issued
label: BODY

text: pursuant to the authority vested in the Administrator of the United States Environmental
label: BODY

text: Protection Agency (“EPA”) by section 309 of the Clean Water Act (“CWA”), 33 U.S.C. § 1319.
label: BODY

text: This authority has been properly delegated to the Assistant Regional Administrator of the Office
label: BODY

text: of Enforcement, Compliance and Environmental Justice, EPA Region 8.  The Order is based on
label: BODY

text: the findings of violation of section 301(a) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1311(a), which, among other
label: BODY

text: things, prohibits the discharge of pollutants (e.g., dredged or fill material) into waters of the
label: BODY

text: United States except as in compliance with section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344.
label: BODY

text: II.  FINDINGS OF VIOLATION
label: HH3

text: 2. Respondent Patrick Goggins is an individual residing in or near Billings, Montana.  At all
label: BODY

text: relevant times, Respondent Vermilion Ranch Co. was a corporation organized under the laws of
label: BODY

text: the State of Montana.
label: BODY

text: 3. At all relevant times, Respondents owned, controlled and or operated property located
label: HH1

text: near the midpoint of Section 6, Township 2 North, Range 28 East, Yellowstone County, Montana
label: BODY

text: containing a portion of the Yellowstone River (the “Site”).
label: BODY

text: 4. In or around February and March 2003, Respondents discharged or caused to be
label: BODY

text: discharged at the Site, without prior authorization from the United States Army Corps of
label: BODY

text: Engineers (“Corps”), approximately 500-600 linear feet of fill material, including but not limited
label: BODY

text: to large concrete slabs and other soil and debris, into the Yellowstone River and on the
label: BODY

text: Yellowstone River’s banks below and above the river’s ordinary high water mark (“OHWM”).
label: BODY

text: 5. The Yellowstone River is tributary to the Missouri River.  The Yellowstone and Missouri
label: BODY

text: Rivers are, and were at all relevant times, navigable, interstate waters.
label: BODY

text: 6. On April 8, 2003, personnel from the Montana Department of Fish, Wildlife and Parks
label: BODY

text: inspected the Site and observed the concrete slabs and other soil and debris in and on the bank of
label: BODY

text: approximately 500-600 linear feet of the Yellowstone River.
label: BODY

text: 7. On May 1, 2003, the Corps sent a letter to Respondent Patrick Goggins advising Mr.
label: BODY

text: Goggins that the Corps had become aware of the unauthorized discharges described in paragraph
label: BODY

text: 4 of Section II of this Order and directing Mr. Goggins to cease and desist any further
label: BODY

text: unauthorized work or development at the Site.  On May 14, 2003, the Corps sent Mr. Goggins a
label: BODY

text: follow-up letter requesting that Mr. Goggins advise the Corps that he would take steps to remedy
label: BODY

text: the unauthorized discharge.
label: BODY

text: 8. On June 23, 2003, the Montana Department of Environmental Quality sent a letter to Mr.
label: BODY

text: Goggins advising him that the unauthorized discharges described in paragraph 4 of Section II of
label: BODY

text: this Order also constituted a violation of the Montana Water Quality Act, Section 75-5-605 and
label: BODY

text: directing Mr. Goggins to take steps to remedy the violation.
label: BODY

text: 9. The activities described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order were performed using
label: BODY

text: common earthmoving vehicles and equipment, including a front-end loader owned by
label: BODY

text: Respondents, a dump truck, and a tracked hoe, all of which were operated by Respondents and/or
label: BODY

text: by one or more individuals on behalf of Respondents.
label: BODY

text: 10.The Yellowstone River bank area that was filled and disturbed by the actions of
label: BODY

text: Respondents described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order provided various functions and
label: BODY

text: values, including wildlife habitat for songbirds, raptors, mammals, reptiles and amphibians;
label: BODY

text: water quality enhancement; flood storage; and food chain support.
label: BODY

text: 11.Respondents are each a "person" within the meaning of section 502(5) of the CWA, 33
label: BODY

text: 12.The discharged fill materials described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order are, and
label: BODY

text: were at all relevant times, “fill material” within the meaning of 33 C.F.R. § 323.2(e) and
label: BODY

text: “pollutants” within the meaning of section 502(6) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1362(6).
label: BODY

text: 13.The vehicles and equipment described in paragraph 9 of Section II of this Order are, and
label: BODY

text: were at all relevant times, each a “point source” within the meaning of section 502(14) of the
label: BODY

text: 14.The Yellowstone and Missouri Rivers and the banks of the Yellowstone River at or
label: BODY

text: below the OHWM referenced in paragraph 5 of Section II of this Order are, and were at all
label: BODY

text: relevant times, “waters of the United States” within the meaning of 33 C.F.R. § 328.3(a) and
label: BODY

text: therefore “navigable waters” within the meaning of section 502(7) of the CWA,
label: BODY

text: 33 U.S.C. § 1362(7).  Pursuant to 33 C.F.R. § 328.4(c)(1), the OHWM defines the limits of the
label: BODY

text: Corps’ jurisdiction over non-tidal waters in the absence of adjacent wetlands.
label: BODY

text: 15.The placement of fill material into and on the banks of the Yellowstone River at or below
label: BODY

text: the OHWM constitutes the “discharge of pollutants” within the meaning of section 502(12) of
label: BODY

text: 16.Section 301(a) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1311, prohibits, among other things, the
label: BODY

text: discharge of pollutants by any person into waters of the United States except as in compliance
label: BODY

text: with section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344.
label: BODY

text: 17.Section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344, sets forth a permitting system authorizing the
label: BODY

text: Secretary of the Army, acting through the Chief of Engineers of the Corps, to issue permits for
label: BODY

text: the discharge of dredged or fill material into the navigable waters, i.e., waters of the United
label: BODY

text: States.
label: BODY

text: 18.33 C.F.R. § 323.3(a) specifies that, unless exempted pursuant to 33 C.F.R. § 323.4,
label: BODY

text: a permit issued by the Corps is required for the discharge of dredged or fill material into waters
label: BODY

text: of the United States.
label: BODY

text: 19.Respondents are not and never have been authorized by a permit issued pursuant to
label: BODY

text: section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344, to conduct any of the activities described in
label: BODY

text: paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order.
label: BODY

text: 20.Respondents’ activities described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order violate section
label: BODY

text: 301 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1311.  Each discharge of pollutants from a point source by
label: BODY

text: Respondents into waters of the United States without the required permits issued pursuant to
label: BODY

text: section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344, constitutes a violation of section 301(a) of the CWA,
label: BODY

text: 33 U.S.C. § 1311(a).  Each day the discharges remain in place without the required permits
label: BODY

text: constitutes an additional day of violation of section 301(a).
label: BODY

text: 21.The removal of the fill material illegally discharged into waters of the United States at the
label: BODY

text: Site and restoration of the impacted waters to a condition that closely approximates their
label: BODY

text: condition and function prior to the discharge of the fill material, can be achieved as a practical
label: BODY

text: matter through commonly used methods of construction, digging, filling, revegetation, and best
label: BODY

text: management practices.
label: BODY

text: 22.Activities to be carried out under this Order are remedial, not punitive, and are necessary
label: BODY

text: to achieve the CWA’s objective “to restore and maintain the chemical, physical, and biological
label: BODY

text: integrity of the Nation’s waters,” as specified in section 101(a) of the CWA,
label: BODY

text: 33 U.S.C. § 1251(a).  The removal and restoration described in paragraph 21 of Section II of this
label: BODY

text: Order are appropriate to alleviate actual and potential harm to water quality, aquatic habitat, and
label: BODY

text: wildlife habitat caused by Respondents’ unpermitted activities.
label: BODY

text: 23.This Order was issued after consultation and coordination with the Corps’ Omaha
label: BODY

text: District, Helena Regulatory Office.
label: BODY

text: III.  ORDER
label: HH3

text: Based upon the foregoing FINDINGS OF VIOLATION, and pursuant to the authority vested
label: BODY

text: in the Administrator of the EPA pursuant to sections 308 and 309(a) of the CWA,
label: BODY

text: 33 U.S.C. §§ 1318 and 1319(a), as properly delegated to the Assistant Regional Administrator of
label: BODY

text: the Office of Enforcement, Compliance and Environmental Justice, EPA Region 8, it is hereby
label: BODY

text: ORDERED:
label: BODY

text: 1. Respondents shall immediately terminate all discharges of dredged or fill materials into
label: HH1

text: waters of the United States, now and in the future, unless specifically authorized by the Corps
label: BODY

text: under a valid permit issued pursuant to section 404 of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1344.  This
label: BODY

text: prohibition includes all bank stabilization, mechanical land clearing, dredging, filling, grading,
label: BODY

text: leveling, installation of utilities, construction, and any other activities that result in a discharge of
label: BODY

text: dredged or fill material into waters of the United States.
label: BODY

text: 2. Within forty-five (45) calendar days of the receipt of this Order, Respondents shall submit
label: BODY

text: to EPA for review and approval a Restoration Plan for the removal of the discharged fill
label: BODY

text: materials described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order and restoration of the area impacted
label: BODY

text: by the discharged fill.  The Restoration Plan shall be prepared in accordance with “U.S.
label: BODY

text: Environmental Protection Agency - Region VIII Section 404 Enforcement:  General Guidelines
label: BODY

text: for Removal and Restoration Plans,” attached hereto as Exhibit A.  Additionally, the Restoration
label: BODY

text: Plan shall:
label: BODY

text: Include a detailed work plan and schedule for all of the work to be accomplished
label: BODY

text: by the Restoration Plan, including the application for any required permits, providing for
label: BODY

text: completion of all aspects of the restoration work no later than
label: BODY

text: August 1, 2004.  The work plan shall, at a minimum, provide specific and detailed provisions
label: BODY

text: for:
label: BODY

text: Removal of the fill materials discharged above and below the OHWM to
label: BODY

text: upland areas in full compliance with and with prior approval of all Federal, State and
label: BODY

text: local requirements, and providing a detailed description (including exact location) of the
label: BODY

text: site to where the material will be relocated and proof that the owner of such site has
label: BODY

text: approved the relocation of the discharged fill materials to such site;
label: BODY

text: ii.
label: BODY

text: Stabilization of any fill material which is placed adjacent to waters of the
label: BODY

text: United States to prevent incidental movement of this material into such waters; and
label: BODY

text: iii. Revegetation of the areas of the Yellowstone River bank impacted by the
label: BODY

text: unauthorized discharges described in paragraph 4 of Section II of this Order with plants
label: BODY

text: indigenous to the area which will prevent or reduce erosion of the river bank.  The
label: BODY

text: revegetation component of the plan must contain grasses, forbs,  and shrubs, and may
label: BODY

text: contain tree species.
label: BODY

text: Be prepared by a qualified hydrologist/engineer experienced in stream and
label: BODY

text: wetland restoration, include detailed professional drawings of the restoration site, including
label: BODY

text: plan and profile drawings with control elevations, and comply with all Federal, State, and
label: BODY

text: local requirements; and
label: BODY

text: Be prepared in accordance with “Nationwide Permits, Regional Conditions, State
label: BODY

text: of Montana, Omaha District - Corps of Engineers,” effective March 18, 2002, attached to
label: BODY

text: this Consent Order as Exhibit B, and “Special Public Notice - Reissuance of the Generic
label: BODY

text: Prohibitions Regarding the Use of Certain Materials as Fill in Waters of the United States,”
label: BODY

text: issued August 4, 2003, attached to this Consent Order as Exhibit C.
label: BODY

text: 3. EPA will review the Restoration Plan and approve it or reject it with comments.  If EPA
label: BODY

text: rejects the Restoration Plan, Respondents shall, within fifteen (15) calendar days of receipt of
label: BODY

text: EPA’s rejection letter, submit a revised plan that corrects the deficiencies identified by EPA.
label: BODY

text: 4. Upon receiving EPA’s written approval of the Restoration Plan, Respondents shall obtain
label: HH1

text: all necessary permits to implement the EPA-approved plan and then commence restoration
label: BODY

text: activities in accordance with the approved plan, including the time frames specified therein, and
label: BODY

text: all granted permits.  Respondents shall demonstrate that all necessary permits have been granted
label: BODY

text: by providing complete copies of all such permits, and any amendments thereto, to EPA within
label: BODY

text: seven (7) calendar days of issuance of each permit.
label: BODY

text: 5. This Order is not a permit or an authorization to place or discharge dredged or fill
label: BODY

text: material in waters of the United States.  Respondents shall consult with the Corps at the
label: BODY

text: following address and telephone number to determine if any work to be performed pursuant to
label: BODY

text: this Order requires a permit from the Corps under section 404 of the CWA:
label: BODY

text: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers, Omaha District
label: BODY

text: Helena Regulatory Office
label: BODY

text: 10 West Fifteenth Street, Suite 2200
label: BODY

text: Helena, Montana 59626
label: BODY

text: If required, Respondents shall obtain such permit(s) and provide a copy to EPA pursuant to
label: BODY

text: paragraph 4 of Section III of this Order prior to initiating any work that is to be performed
label: BODY

text: pursuant to this Order.
label: BODY

text: 6. At least ten (10) calendar days prior to the anticipated completion of all restoration
label: BODY

text: activities in accordance with the approved Restoration Plan, Respondents shall notify EPA so
label: BODY

text: that EPA can arrange a final interagency inspection of the completed restoration activities.
label: BODY

text: 7. Respondents shall submit three (3) copies of the Restoration Plan, all notifications, and
label: BODY

text: related correspondence to:
label: BODY

text: Kristine Knutson
label: BODY

text: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency
label: BODY

text: 10 West Fifteenth Street, Suite 3200
label: BODY

text: Helena, Montana 59626
label: BODY

text: A copy of the restoration plan, all notifications, and related correspondence shall also be
label: BODY

text: provided to:
label: BODY

text: Sheldon H. Muller, 8ENF-L
label: BODY

text: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Region 8
label: BODY

text: 999 18th Street, Suite 300
label: BODY

text: Denver, CO  80202-2466
label: BODY

text: Telephone:  303-312-6916
label: BODY

text: Facsimile:    303-312-6953
label: BODY

text: 8. Any deliverables, plans, reports, specifications, schedules, and attachments required by
label: BODY

text: this Order are, upon approval by EPA, incorporated into this Order.  Any non-compliance with
label: BODY

text: such EPA-approved deliverables, plans, reports, specifications, schedules, and attachments shall
label: BODY

text: be deemed a failure to comply with this Order and subject to EPA enforcement.
label: BODY

text: 9. Respondents shall allow, or use their best effort to allow, access by any authorized
label: BODY

text: representatives of EPA, the Corps, the Natural Resources Conservation Service, the U.S. Fish
label: BODY

text: and Wildlife Service, the Soil Conservation Service, the Montana Department of Environmental
label: BODY

text: Quality, the Montana Department of Fish, Wildlife and Parks and the Yellowstone County
label: BODY

text: Conservation District, or any of these agencies’ contractors, upon proper presentation of
label: BODY

text: credentials, to sites and records relevant to this Order for any of the following purposes:
label: BODY

text: To inspect and monitor progress of the activities required by this Order;
label: BODY

text: To inspect and monitor compliance with this Order; and
label: BODY

text: To verify and evaluate data and other information submitted to EPA.
label: BODY

text: This Order shall in no way limit or otherwise affect EPA's authority, or the authority of any other
label: BODY

text: governmental agency, to enter the Site, conduct inspections, have access to records, issue notices
label: BODY

text: and orders for enforcement, compliance, or abatement purposes, or monitor compliance pursuant
label: BODY

text: to any statute, regulation, permit, or court order.
label: BODY

text: 10. This Order shall be effective upon receipt.  Within five (5) calendar days of receipt of
label: BODY

text: this Order, Respondents shall inform EPA in writing of Respondents’ intent to fully comply with
label: BODY

text: the Order.
label: BODY

text: 11.Please be advised that section 309(d) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1319(d), as modified by
label: BODY

text: the Civil Monetary Penalty Inflation Adjustment Rule, 69 Federal Register 7121 (February 13,
label: BODY

text: 2004), authorizes civil penalties of up to $32,500 per day for each violation of section 301 of the
label: BODY

text: CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1311, and for each violation of an order issued by the Administrator of EPA
label: BODY

text: under section 309(a) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1319(a).  Additionally, section 309(g) of the
label: BODY

text: CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1319(g), authorizes EPA to impose administrative penalties for violations of
label: BODY

text: the CWA.  Further, section 309(c) of the CWA, 33 U.S.C. § 1319(c), authorizes fines and
label: BODY

text: imprisonment for willful or negligent violations of the CWA.  Issuance of this Order shall not be
label: BODY

text: deemed to be an election by the United States to forego any civil or criminal action to seek
label: BODY

text: penalties, fines, or other appropriate relief under the CWA for violations giving rise to the Order.
label: BODY

text: 12.Compliance with the terms and conditions of the Order shall not be construed to relieve
label: BODY

text: Respondents of their obligation to comply with any applicable federal, state or local law.  Failure
label: BODY

text: by Respondents to complete the tasks described herein in the manner and time frame specified
label: BODY

text: pursuant to this Order may subject Respondents to a civil action under section 309 of the Clean
label: BODY

text: Water Act, 33 U.S.C. section 1319, for violation of this Order.
label: BODY

text: DATED this   10TH       day of June, 2004.
label: BODY
